website_summaries.verdict: The Garmin Vivosmart HR does fitness and heart rate tracking just about as well as the Fitbit Charge HR while adding smartphone alerts, too, all in a compact package.
pros: All-day heart rate and fitness tracking
cons: Its Garmin Connect mobile app isn't as refined as apps from Fitbit or Jawbone
No smart coaching or personalized feedback

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 Fitbits in the last 3 years. None of them have lasted long enough to pay that much. This Garmin has the best bang for the buck and does more than ever expected. I've been dependent on my phone to remind me to take my meds or flow news flashes and weather alerts but it's always on silent because of what I do at work. Now I see it all on my wrist when it vibrates. It's helped me stay on top of my meds and deliver news/weather in meetings when it matters. It's also motivated me to get up and walk more with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Cornflower

customer_reviews.title: Garmin products all seem to fail shortly after the warranty runs out.
customer_reviews.text: Battery stopped holding a charge after 14 my months. I own a number of garmin products mainly for their features but none of them last very long or they are defective. I went through 4 920xt due to hardware failures and the last one failed after a year. My daughters vivoactive hr screen cracked after a couple months and my 520 caught fire and melted on the usb charger plugged into a usb block. Every time I’ve had to fight with garmin to get replacements when within he warranty period. My experience with customer service has been awful. I do know other athletes that have had positive experiences with customer service but that hasn’t been the case with me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Muldowney

customer_reviews.title: Tracker ok, Connect app is invasive.
customer_reviews.text: Tracker workes fine. My issue is with thw Garmin Connect app. It requests permission to access ALL files on your phone. I denied access to my media and pictures (why would an activity tracker need this?). So the app continually told me permission was required. This prompted repeatedly through the day and night and drained my phone battery about 30 % overnight. I emailed Garmin tech support and they told me this was "necessary" to run the app.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the vivofit 2 - the built-in HR monitor works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Vivofit 2 that we lost. My wife had avoided built-in HR monitors and been using a separate Garmin HR strap, but thought she would give this a try. Surprisingly - it works very well! The vivosmart HR does lose 1 star because the display is not as bright as the Vivofit 2, and it has a specialized charging cable that is nearly impossible to find in stores. So that's one more thing to remember to pack when traveling because the battery only lasts 3 days max. (The vivofit 2 - the non-chargeable battery lasts for months)
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: FRAGILE!  And HR is frequently inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Garmin claims it is shock resistant. It got gently brushed off the couch and fell 12" to the floor and the display cracked. They will not warranty it. Do NOT buy this. If you so much as bump into something with it on your wrist it will explode. Also, it does not automatically track exercise....and heart rate monitor frequently trips out and in the middle of an intense workout will drop down to 80 or 90 BPM for a few minutes, several times during 45-60m sessions. Inaccurate. Also the app is kind of poop. I will never buy garmin products again....they do not stand by their claims.
customer_reviews.author: Jack kileen

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for one reason: to be able to monitor my heart rate as I exercise. IT DOESN'T WORK! I've tried everything: different placements on my wrist (high, low, inside of my wrist, outside, and everything in between), cleaning it with gentle soap after every time I exercise, different band adjustments (tight, medium, loose), etc. Nothing I do works. I can be exercising like crazy, feel my heart racing and my Garmin vivosmart heart rate reads 70 - not likely! I am SO DISAPPOINTED. I finally got a chest strap and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mayo, Executive Coach for Business Owners

customer_reviews.title: Like the features and how its waterproof
customer_reviews.text: A great device that's survived oceans, pools, showers, and hot springs. Syncs well with myfitnesspal. The only thing is I wish the battery life was longer. I have to charge mine every 3 days in order to ensure it doesn't die. Also, I live at the top of a hill and sometimes when I drive up it, it thinks I walked it and congratulates me for meeting my stair climbing goal, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Farah

customer_reviews.title: Working well after about a month!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a "somewhat of a smartwatch" that has the features I want, at a great price point! I needed the heart rate monitor and be able to track calories burned. Seems fairly accurate and helping me use tech to lose weight. I realize these features aren't for everyone, however, the features I previously mentioned are perfect for me. Took me about 10 minutes to download the app for my iPhone and get paired AND sign up on the Garmin site as well. Paired without issue to my phone. It seems pretty rugged and comfortable after wearing for about a month. I'd recommend this Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different trackers and I think this may be my favorite. Love that it has heart rate, calories, steps, and more plus notifications and phone controls. It does as much or more then others that cost more. Works with MyFitnessPal which was the big selling point for me because I track calories daily. Pros: Feature rich, easy to read day or night, MFP compatible, longer battery life then most competitors, sync is easy. Cons: Not many.. stairs climb can be a bit wonky, doesn't work with Samsung health app
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Returning a Fitbit Charge 3 which cost twice that of the Garmin vivosmart HR, the Garmin worked right out of the box and did not, like FBC3, take 2 hours to set up and all the features work! If you just want a simple tracker for walking, heart rate and sleep, time and date this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Super durable fitness tracker and safety gear
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate tracking works as expected. Battery life is superb I just charge it every time I shower and it stays topped off. The tracker even saved my arm when I fell off a longboard and slid on asphalt by keeping it off the ground and taking all the damage. The tracker is still working perfectly with a scratched up screen and some rubber missing from the corners.If you fall off a long board, it'll scuff up, but you'll be okay. Definitely recommend if you plan on boarding! Doubles as safety gear!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Hurts Small Wrist
customer_reviews.text: I like Garmin products. I like everything about this band. The problem is I can't wear it. I have a small wrist and the protrusion of the heart sensor hurts my smaller wrist. I've tried different positions and tightness levels, but no luck so far. I may still get a different Garmin product, or something with a rounder heart sensor. I tried contacting Garmin support, but it seems to take awhile before they get back with you.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Just say no to Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another Garmin product. I have purchased 2 of this exact same watch since February of 2017, and they have both broken in the same spot (both of which occurred when simply wrapping the watch around my wrist.) I purchased a Square Trade warranty on the second one and unsurprisingly they said this particular problem is not covered. I didn't find the step tracking to be particularly accurate, nor the heart rate monitoring, so no great loss, but it is really frustrating to have to replace another poor quality device.
customer_reviews.author: gill

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Difficult to read when illuminated
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father to use since he was very much interested in the Fitbit I was using. I like Garmin products in general and decided to give this tracker a try. I opened it up and needed to charge it up before preparing to use it. The amount of force to snap into the charger had me worried at first that I was going to break the screen pushing down. After charging, I realized the arm band wasn't going to fit his wrist and it was snug on mine. When the display was fully lit, it was difficult to read. I gave up and returned the unit for a brand new Fitbit model.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parduhn

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished and bought 2 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I bought this refurbished almost 2 years ago and it has worked well. The battery is now dying so I bought a new Garmin vivosmart HR+ . I wear these 24/7 including the shower and average 23k steps per day, so I'm happy it lasted 2 years. The floors counter was always questionable and I never really paid attention to the HR monitor, but it worked well. I also wear a Fitbit Charge 2 HR, it works well but the step count is not as reliable as the Garmin, it counts more steps for hand movements so I don't consider it as reliable for actual steps.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Hower

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy Without a Smart Phone-Computer Connection In Operable
customer_reviews.text: Made a mistake buying this watch thinking that the Amazon description was accurate. It isn't. It is impossible to set up for computer access. Garmin website doesn't recognize the vivosmartHR and downloading any application can not be found on Garmin's website. With what they charge for these watches, you would think they would have only a FAQ section.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way better quality than Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I went through a few Fitbits in a year and decided to ditch that for the Garmin product. I've had the same Garmin for 2 years now and it still works great. You can get 6-7 days from a charge (i still do after 2 years). The bands are easily replaceable and there are some sellers on Amazon. If you don't like a big bulky watch, buy this product. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RealLifeEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching fitness bands, from the least expensive off brands to the top model fitbits. Finally, I landed on this one and I couldn't be happier. The display looks nice and is even more functional than I expected, the app provides a ton of information, and so far the band seems to be fairly accurate. I don't expect the heart rate monitor to be spot on every moment of the day, but from what I can tell it provides a good daily/weekly picture of your resting and active HR. For $60, I don't think you can do much better.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tracking, App interactions, Heart Rate monitor, Priced Right, and other great functions.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as my "Jawbone" was outdated and I needed something new. I've used it for two days, so far great tracker. I like the "MOVE!" alert as I find myself sitting. This app interacts with other apps as well. I personally went with the refurbished as paying over $100.00 for any tracker doesn't seem reasonable as the market seems to be evolving faster with more upgrades. The heart rate monitor stays within the range of 4-5 beats as I compared on two different occasions with pulse ox. I do like the calendar part of this app to see what my overall progress is day by day and stay motivated. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar_Mike86

customer_reviews.title: Working well for my needs -- only wish it recognized swim strokes and lap times. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons I chose this model was I wanted a waterproof tracker I could use to log swim data. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is it doesn't recognize swimming automatically like it does when I walk. Am able to log manually in the app when I complete swim, but I thought it would recognize the motion and categorize that activity automatically. Still, not a big deal. Otherwise the interface is fine, I'm able to read the display well, and the app works fine for my needs. I bought a refurbished model and have had no issues after a few weeks of use. Good as new. :)
customer_reviews.author: cdogzilla

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this if heart-rate data is most important for you.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year now. It mostly serves its purpose - help me keep moving. It's lousy at registering my heart rate though (the handlebar monitors on aerobic machines at the gym do a better job if that gives you any idea about how bad this is) Full disclosure, I'm a skinny, pale-skinned, middle-aged, woman with below-average body temp. (It's also bad about figuring out when I go to sleep at night, but that's so low on my list I don't bother) That said, it's been useful as a trend tracker and wrist-mounted phone notification.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great watch to have!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact watch about 3 years ago and loved it! Some of the features I really like are the heart rate and sleep monitor. Also it keeps track of the weather, stairs climbed, emails,and text messages to name a few. It’s so comfortable to wear I never take it off except when I need to charge it. I would recommend this watch and give it 5 +stars ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The first five weeks of wearing this watch were great. After that, the sync stopped working. Then the stair counter stopped being accurate. Then I couldn't get the weather on it. Then my notifications stopped working. Now the step counter works when it feels like it. I have tried every conceivable way to resync the watch and delete and reinstall the app, and now I'm done wasting my time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, comfortable, accurate, recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great that instruction manual available online via Garmin site, actually had to speak with customer service, excellent response. Battery life over a week. Paired with Android phone, therefore all notifications coming through. Have not experienced water resistance yet. Little awkward reading e-mails, texts while wearing. Note that in conversation with Garmin, this watch was shipped by them to the retailer November 2016?
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Better than Fitbit!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! This is actually my second one, exact same model. There seem to be a few glitches because of the new update that my old one didn't have but I sill really like it and for the price, It's awesome. I'm glad I picked this over the Fitbit because it has a lot more functions like being able to read your notifications, waterproof, and the different workouts that it tracks. The only thing that is better on the fitbit is the look, I wish they made changeable bands for these. But its not super important to me which is why I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Returning it...
customer_reviews.text: Sending it back 1. The thickness...catches on everything from putting on clothes and working. Dont know how any woman can find this not annoying. 2. The band..probably can be changed don't like it. 3. The Bluetooth...not getting alarms. Have it set for 4:30am and rarely vibrates me to wake up. 4. The heart rate monitor....NOT SURE IF IT'S MY SKIN TONE (BLACK) BUT IT SENDS A NUMBNESS SENSATION IN MY WRIST WHEN READING. 5. The charging...compared a previous purchase the watch usb snap on port is good. 6. Alerts...delay on e-mails and sms. 7. Backlighting....didn't read much about it but needs to be improved. Not good for daily working in highly active style jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Harber

customer_reviews.title: Great once figure out!
customer_reviews.text: Received for Christmas and although I was skeptical at first due to it being so much different than my last Garmin device I love it now. The only drawback is the screen is real easy to scratch which was not an issue with old device. Getting the unit on and charged took me a little more time as I could not get it working until visiting You Tube for instructions. After watching a couple of videos it got easier to get on track. Seems to be efficient on battery life (approx. 4-5 days); charging is pretty quick unless battery is truly dead. Steps seem accurate and I enjoy the feature of obtaining pulse rate periodically.
customer_reviews.author: carolina star 12

customer_reviews.title: A really great item!
customer_reviews.text: I hate exercise and would get caught up in all the other things there are to do in life until I got this. The "Move!" prompt cracks me up as well as reminds me to get to it - I've had this for a couple months now and there haven't been many days that I don't make the goal. The other fun stuff it does (like tracking stairs climbed, setting goals for intensity minutes for the week, keeping track of not only how many hours you have slept but also whether it is deep sleep or light sleep) keeps things interesting, too. I'm totally glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Do not wear unless you first get a screen protector!
customer_reviews.text: The screen on this scratches extremely easily. I wore it to before my screen protectors arrived and by the end of the day the screen had been scratched. I work a desk job and so this was just from normal day-to-day activities. The seller was amazing and offered to replace it when I notified them but this was on me and I did not take them about it. Also, even went on Macs the screen is not very bright. But I am finding it to be an extremely accurate tracker and would recommend you purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: 1 year review
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this for about 1 year. I bought it because I wanted tech to track water walking (not swimming). Well it doesn’t do that at all. I was disappointed - completely. The only mitigating features were the excellent software, waterproofing and supposed privacy claims...I don’t trust Google/Fitbit with my data -at all. 1 year in and I still like these features, but the band has come apart in two different places during the past month. The wristband buckle fell off 6months in. Unfortunately, The band is made of very cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Love this Garmin Vivosmart HR! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Garmin vivosmart HR. This is my 3rd Garmin activity tracker. This replaced another vivosmart HR that the band broke after wearing it everyday for 2 years. I didn't realize that it was a replaceable band and tried to glue it. I'm happy I stuck with Garmin. And I also ordered a spare band, just in case... I like how it syncs easily with Garmin Connect app and with MyFitnessPal. Makes it easier to stay on track. Highly recommend! it's comfortable to wear And fits well on a small wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Now on track
customer_reviews.text: It took some time for me to choose what type of tracker I was interested in and decided upon this one. I am satisfied. I compared recharge time and the many options available. The only noticeable difference I could find was this one recharges depending on the apps around 7-8 days as others can go up to 3 weeks. Based on the price difference, 7-8 days was ok. I was at one time using my phone app for tracking and as you know the phone does not go everywhere. In addition, this has gotten me back to wearing a watch. I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce AC

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Watch - Tells Time Too!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using mine for over a year now and haven't had any major issues. I like the step counter even though I rarely hit my mark. The exercises are great, I enjoy using them whenever I can. I especially enjoy the sleep mode - lets others know if I'm going to be in a cranky mood. Oh wait, that's normal. I mostly like to walk during my lunch break and this little gem is a great motivator. For a great medium replacement band very close to the original go here:- They also have a nice Pink and Blue with the black claps. All in all, great purchase. I love my Garmin Vivosmart. My friends are so jealous.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. ProvinceTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: its a good tracker but does not keep up with the accuracy ...
customer_reviews.text: its a good tracker but does not keep up with the accuracy of the heart rate during exercise all the time. i try to do HIIT workouts and so i rely on my heart rate as a guide, but occasionally it would be saying 100-120 when i can time the actual reading to be about >160. i had one from this company before but i didnt want to bother with the chest strap and i wanted all day heart rate monitoring. this is also great for tracking sleep and it links with my fitness pal app. i want to get one for my other half as well!! i recommend it all the time!!
customer_reviews.author: vincylewis

customer_reviews.title: only a 3
customer_reviews.text: I like the screen. It's large enough to read without being bulky. The device is very light weight. I wish I could change the strap to something more attractive. The steps are not as accurate as my Fitbit HR. The sleep tracker shows sleeping if you sit to read while studying for more than an hour. It shows light sleep. The app is not very user friendly. I had to use another app to add food for calorie intake/use which is a waste of time downloading the app at all. Notifications are good. I like it's water resistant as well.
customer_reviews.author: TitaGee

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say that I have my MS in Exercise Physiology and I've been using heart rate monitors for over 30 years for exercise and resting heart rate. That being said, the heart rate monitor for this watch is horrible. No matter what orientation I wear the watch, or how clean/sweaty my skin is, the heart rate is way off compared to my chest strap. Really dissapointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this fitness tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several fitness tracker watches before this one and this really is the best. The battery lasts at least a week. Through the app you can customize what info shows up in your wristband, including the weather. The heart rate monitor and step tracker seem much more accurate than the other ones I've used. The step tracker is sensitive enough to count steps, but not so sensitive it counts every twitch of the hand. It's comfortable and fastens like a normal watch so it doesn't come undone and is easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this again. should of bought another fitbit even though they generally don't last more than a year. Absolutely horrible. Wrist band barely fits my wrist and is a struggle to put on each day. It clearly is not accurate. on anything. No visual or mobile app indication when battery is low. The charging mechanism is a pain as well. Sleep monitor doesn't record REM time. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael lamontagne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I love the reminder to move, and the notification for phone calls and text messages, and the ability to track stairs. I dislike how easily the little rubber part that holds the excess band broke so easily, and how easy it was to scuff, scratch and chip the face. Note: I have only had *this particular* tracker for a few days, but I had the same model previously. It lasted almost two years before l I could no longer deal with the damaged screen. I thought about getting a different model, I really did like this one, and the price was right. Be sure to purchase a screen protector. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Diana B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Upgrade from Vivófit 2
customer_reviews.text: I got this after having the Vivófit 2 for 2 years and I wanted an upgrade!!! I am immensely impressed! I'm not looking for the watch to read my horoscope or anything! It does everything I want it to and so much more! I absolutely love it and I'm glad that I upgraded to this one because I was going back and forth for awhile but I absolutely love the watch haven't had any issues and the charge is just fine! Definitely worth the price and worth the try!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AUBrown07

customer_reviews.title: Wow! On for 4 hours now and still working!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike two of a different brand, one lasting 1 1/2 hr, and the replacement not at all! Both were a lot more expensive. This seems to work great, but not able to evaluate battery life yet. In any case, my wife loves it! Our main interest is tracking the footsteps in a day to keep active. Next would be time, then heart rate. UPDATE: 1-11-19: It even accurately tracks sleep patters! AWESOME! I wore it all of yesterday, (my wife's) and checked the long distance...5+ miles data. We love it! I may get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kitsko

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my wife for her birthday and she ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife for her birthday and she loves it. Everything works as advertised.My daughter has the same product and she loves her's as well. Well worth the price and will contribute to our family's health.
customer_reviews.author: Strider1956

customer_reviews.title: Garmin fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: It is a basic tracker which gives you HR & steps not bad . I’m sure they have trackers & watches that have more options available . It was just okay I wanted more than it gave me . Only kind of accurate for steps but for me very difficult to pair with my phone took me 3 days . They just couldn’t sync easily once they were it was fine . I ended up upgrading to a different kind of tracker . I gave this one to my sister who wanted very basic . Garmin has a great product but this one not what I needed .
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product!!! I was surprised to learn that it does have text/call notifications. Love the alarm feature, which was scary the first time it work me up you have to snooze it off or your wrist continues to vibrate. Pair this with a bluetooth headset and it works great. I listen to music also which is paired with my phone. Only down side is that steps counted will not count as you ride a bike and battery life is only 3-4 days. Other than that I am glad I purchased
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Heart Rate Function Extremely Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate function on this device is extremely inaccurate and precise. It works fine when you are not exercising however it is off by 30-40 beats when exercising. During the first 40 mins or so it is 30-40 beats low. During the last 20 mins it can be 30 beats high. I have tried a dozen things to try to fix it including everything suggested by Garmin. The other functions of the device work fairly well. If you are looking for a device that monitors heart rate, as I was, I would not purchase this device.
customer_reviews.author: M. Manfredi

customer_reviews.title: Daily Activity Tracker Watch
customer_reviews.text: Garmin vivosmart HR activity tracker is a very helpful exercise watch for budget minded person. It’s keep track of your daily steps, calories used, health rate, stairs climbed, sleep pattern, cycling tells Time. It you synced it to their app you can receive weather, emails. I usually kept mine on my wrist until it’s time to recharge which is like every 6 days. The device will tell you when battery runs low. This may be similar to devices like Fitbit and others but I can only speak about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a year, but no longer calculates heart rate. It seems to get stuck at 80 or 90 bpm while doing vigorous exercise. For a while it was fun to track intensity minutes, and the watch seems to know if you’re biking or on an elliptical which is cool. It was helpful in tracking and getting into better sleep routines. Unfortunately now it’s nothing more than a watch.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua miller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice activity tracker with notifications from phone apps.
customer_reviews.text: Had a Pebble for a few years but it croaked and well Pebble is out of business and I didn't want to spend a bunch of money on another smart watch till they get better. Bought a cheap tracker and it was ok but then I saw this for under $70 and jumped on it. This isn't a Pebble but does everything I need. App notifications included. So I like it a lot, but still miss my Pebble. Oh yeah and the battery lasts a week between charge.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 11 year old son.... HE LOVES IT! It fits him very well, and is easy for him to use. He loves the alerts, and notifications... Because my son is superior to all other children, it will likely not be as easy for your small child to use, but know with good role modeling, and proper parenting, your child will also be able to use this watch in due time. Good luck, and hopefully whomever this is intended for will be able to have as much fun, and great use as my son. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Eric U

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable for steps or heart rate!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It is waterproof. Cons: It is not accurate for steps or heartrate. It will not measure steps unless you swing your arm. If you are carrying something, doing water aerobics, walking on a treadmill, it does not work. If you sit in a chair and swing your arm, it counts steps. The heart rate monitor seems to generate random numbers. Just now, my Polar HRM was showing 109 BPS and this Garmin was reporting 44 BPS. I used a Fitbit HR and switched to Garmin since it was waterproof. Big mistake. Going back to Fitbit even though their software is ultra buggy. At least it counts steps and not arm motion.
customer_reviews.author: BPRadar

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st fitness tracking watch, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I LOVE it! It seems pretty accurate most of the time. It's comfortable to wear. I love the dark purple color. It's easy to charge. It's really easy to use. My only issue is the band recently broke, but there is a free replacement warranty. I'm just waiting to hear back from garmin about getting that since it's link wasn't working. I'd recommend this anyone, in fact, my sister bought the same one after I raved about it.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: The website is not great and trying to connect with someone
customer_reviews.text: has consistent issue with syncing to my phone. Have to continually re-pair and one time it cleared all previous data when I repaired it. The website is not great and trying to connect with someone. It also has a very high profile and makes it difficult to wear and use with some gym equipment. I like my fit-bit better because I have a job which at times requires me to remove my watch for long period. When I have this in my pocket it does not track any steps :-( , but the fitbit will.
customer_reviews.author: tbillrn

customer_reviews.title: Bonus! Previous owner’s dead skin cells included!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one where the band broke and it fell off my wrist while I was in the airport. I know it is refurbished but I didn’t expect it would arrive filthy and gross. It has what looks like either foundation makeup or skin cells in the crevices of the watch. I’m shocked that somebody would consider this “ready” to go to a new person . So gross! Zero stars. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The tracker itself is nice comfortable and somehow accurate for heart rate. The thing is, it's app doesn't work on several models of mobiles, which is a waste. I couldn't use the phone features on my Sony Xperia Z5 premium It's water proof, I used it for swimming and during my shower. But it doesn't have a separate swimming exercise tracking option, I placed it on cardio when I swam The climbing stairs is not very accurate, it sometimes misses some stairs climbing and sometimes adds stairs climbing when I'm using the escalators
customer_reviews.author: huda sammour

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof makes this brand superior
customer_reviews.text: Go with Garmin. It appears to be the only product that is fully waterproof. Beware of competitors who offer "water resistant" products. One bath or entry into a pool and it is ruined. A waterproof device will allow you credit for exercise when swimming or doing water aerobics. Garmin Express and Connect are good management pages. Two members of a family may log each individual unit. For multiple units you must use a separate eMail address for each individual unit (but two eMail addresses are common now in order to give an eMail address which you suspect will be sent daily advertising messages which can be eliminated quickly). The three colors available allow family members to identify their unit.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good product but it is always a problem sinc-ing with the computer, I have to do it multiple times to get it to download and update. Other than that I love that it reminds me to move and I have lost over 20 lbs in the past 6 months and I attribute at least some of that to this device. Gets me up and out of my chair through out the day so I can walk up and down the stairs a few times and a 30 minute walk at lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Completely stupid sleep tracking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to track sleep, it was supposed to have automatic sleep tracking (so you don't have to remembet to turn it on and off). But the sleep tracking is quite bad. You tell the device what is your sleeping time range, it will assume that your are sleeping that whole time unless you are walking. So this works only for people that go to sleep and wake up at exactly the same time every day, which probably won't need a sleep tracker anyway. It's a pity, because the other functions are quite practical.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Fitbit HR, but it broke after 18 months. I decided to get this as my son has a Garmin tracker as well. Thus far I am in love with it. The large screen is easy to read, even in the middle of the night without my glasses. It quickly charges and holds a charge for the advertised timeframe. The only con that I would have is that it is sensitive for "stair climbing". If I go hiking then it can read that I climbed 30+ stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor feature is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Expensive to just be a gimmick. If you want something to buzz on your wrist to remind you to move every hour then this is for you. If you are interested in the heart rate monitor 'feature' then don't bother. It has a mind of its own. It is somewhat accurate only for resting heart rate. When moving it is often off by huge amounts. Some days it works fine. Others it is nowhere close. It is useless for monitoring your active heart rate when the reading is off by 50 beats per minute. Poor product that cannot be trusted. Not useful as a fitness product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud but non-detectable vibration is a deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tracker right out of the box. I put it on my wrist and saw my resting HR. The OLED display is gorgeous and the menus easy to navigate. Then ... the "silent alert" went off. It buzzed audibly but the vibration was barely noticeable on my wrist. That's stupid! The whole point is to get an alert that I detect, but nobody else. I want to be woken by a vibration -- not by my wife poking me and telling me to stop waking her up with the loud buzzing! Sorry Garmin, this is a deal breaker. This is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I have had Samsung and Fitbits previously and the Garmin is definitely lacking in every area. I am required to manually sync the tracker in the app when I want updated data, the sync takes up to 30 seconds at times and the data does not transfer over to my other apps although the permissions are set properly. To top it off, after less than 4 months of having this product, the band on it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed in this item! The only thing it was counting accurately were the steps... I can get a cheap pedometer for that! I found that it NEVER accurately recorded my heart rate. When I exercise on a piece of equipment with a heart monitor, the Garmin always showed my heart beating at under 100bpm, when I was sweating, and the machine said my heart was at over 140bpm.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor does not work correctly
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Bluetooth feature that allows you to see all the notifications from your phone, but that’s about all I’m happy with. The main reason why I purchased this was to track my heart rate during my workouts, and the heart rate monitor does not work correctly. It will show a higher rate while I’m doing ordinary things around the house than when I’m in the midst of a cardio workout. It’s very annoying. I clean the sensor and wear it as per the instructions, but it still does not work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and, while he's only had it for a week or two, so far he is delighted. Great at sleep tracking, mobile apps, and providing useful analytics. I'll get back after a month or so and let you know. It's 2020 and we're all becoming health conscious. This is a useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: New Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Solid middle of the road fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for tracking movement. Has a little learning curve when it comes to weightlifting and tracking but it’s more on point than others in the same price range. Love that it came with 2 chargers so one stays home and the other is at work. Charges super quick if you forget too
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: Love it. About two years and still going strong. The biggest complaint is the poor strap design. Just replaced it for $6. There's only two little screws per side really holding it down with not much backing under the screw to be held down. When it came undone I dabbed a little super glue to hold it back it place until the actual strap snapped and needed a full replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Walz

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July 2017. Loved it and it worked great until this year. In February my stairs climbed was way off. I have contacted Garmin twice on this and the first time was told to clean the sensors on the back, I did but did nothing for my problem. Second time was told this is normal as the holes in the bottom of unit feel air and will count stairs if it is windy. Problem is it counts stairs all the time even inside while I am working. So I am not happy and will not buy another Garmin product.
customer_reviews.author: B Vanhouten

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitoring for exercise totally inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice watch. But I bought it to replace a Timex monitor with chest strap The Garmin was completely inaccurate, heart rate fluctuated all the time. The harder I went, the lower my heart rate. Ended up purchasing another Timex. Wore them both while exercising. Garmin usually stayed 20-30 beats behind the Timex, but sometimes at low intensity it recorded higher heart rates. If you are serious about monitoring your heart rate, do not rely on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warnings are true, sadly
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this up until this week. After 9 months, it no longer likes to pair with my phone. It will not connect. I've tried powering it off, nothing. And since being able to check text messages was one of the reasons I got it. I now have to purchase something else. Don't waste your money, like I did. Heed the warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Angi K

customer_reviews.title: steps and sleep seem to record very accurately (when it does finally synch) and it is of very sturdy construction. The reason I switched from a FitBit ...
customer_reviews.text: My main issue is that it frequently becomes disconnected from my iPhone and will not synch for sometimes two days. I have to repeatedly go through the Bluetooth connection process to get it back up. Also, my flights of stairs do not register. I am routinely up and down 8-10 times a day and I am lucky if it registers one. On the plus sign, steps and sleep seem to record very accurately (when it does finally synch) and it is of very sturdy construction. The reason I switched from a FitBit is because the band kept coming unglued and falling apart. Went through 3 of them in 2 years
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Juliano

customer_reviews.title: Cracked glass....while doing nothing!
customer_reviews.text: Screen shattered while sitting in a lawn chair doing absolutely nothing. I guess I would feel better if I had been doing something awesome while this happened....like tracking steps and activities! There is nothing they can do to fix this problem you have to buy a completely new garmin. I called support and they said it was a "very durable product". Maybe it just cracks when you are being too lazy! Well good thing for me I can still use it for now as long as I can see through the cracks. I did learn that I should read all the bad reviews first. Other than the screen it was great! I only had this for 3 1/2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Garmin vivosmart HR is very accurate on distance but heart rate is not. The overall app is great and is easy to use. I like it and so does my wife and daughter. This was a great buy for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I Love this gadget! I am starting to get in shape and is a great little that helps me keep track of my movements, exercise time and calories burned in every workout session. The connectivity with the garmin app is amazing, and is a great motivator. Very light weight, easy to use and lasting battery. The only thing I found a bit annoying was the inaccuracy of the distance counter...it has a deviation of approximately 200m per kilometer, this is probably because the lack of GPS, but overall, for someone getting into the workout world is a wonderful tool to get hooked up, and maybe later get one with GPS. beginners
customer_reviews.author: TATI13

customer_reviews.title: Decent heart rate monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is working pretty well so far... Not sure how accurate the running feature is, seems a bit generous for mile times and distances covered. I like the easy interface and ability to lock the view. It synced easily to my phone but I'm afraid the connection may be draining my phone battery, I went for a run with my phone at 40% battery and it was dead after 10 minutes. Could have been other issues though. I use this primarily for cardio and spin classes to track my heart rate. I haven't used it yet for sleep tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy P

customer_reviews.title: Great data collection.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Vivosmsrt with a few minor exceptions. Unlike a Vicodin it has to be charged potentially missing some activity. However, all fitness trackers in this range need charging. The stair climber isn’t as accurate as I think it should be. The instructions say to avoid using handrails or if you’re carrying something. At my age especially you should use handrails.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracker for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: So far, this tracker has been amazing. My steps, heart rate (for when I workout), simple alerts like email and text while I'm working out help so if there's something important I can address it quickly. The battery life is great and the set is very easy to use. Initial setup took awhile because you have to get it synced to bluetooth, the garmin app then the wrist set itself but once that is done it's a piece of cake. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Elson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: It’s really nice but the box wasn’t sealed and the battery was dead so I had to charge it but it seems to work ok I’ll update later when I test it out n if it’s perfect I’ll buy another as a gift, I had gave this as a Xmas gift n I bought another this one is purple but very light purple looks almost black but I love it , it’s synced perfectly with my phone Garmin app n functions well.this was my workout today it’s works really well
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: awesome tracker - this is my 5th year tracking (wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome tracker - this is my 5th year tracking (wearing about 362 days a year for all of them), with 3 previous trackers. Love the waterproof factor!!! others have been damaged by water splashes, including 2 very expensive fitbit HR. Also prefer the fast charge and Garmin's 5 day charging cycle to the fitbit at 3 days. I don't use the HR on any of them - not helpful, question the accuracy, hard to look at while your on a machine working out.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Horrible devise, very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Horrible devise, very inaccurate. Spent 20 minutes on a treadmill and it recorded less than 50 steps. Going up and down stairs may record a quarter of the time, but stand up from my desk and walking to the printer (flat surface, no steps, appropriately 30’) would count. Stopped wearing it as I don’t trust it to be accurate. Have bought other Garmin products that worked fine, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a Fitbit Charge 2 on May 12 in trust of a better outcome.
customer_reviews.text: The device worked properly for two months and then began generating problems connecting with my I-phone. Since that time, I could only connect using bluetooth after painstakingly repeating the initial start device procedure. On May 10, no matter what I tried, the device would not connect. I attempted to contact Garmin, but alas, to no avail. Needless to say,I am no longer a Garmin fan. I purchased a Fitbit Charge 2 on May 12 in trust of a better outcome.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tracker, Very Good App
customer_reviews.text: Love the Garmin Vivosmart HR Tracker enough, that this one was for my daughter, I have one I love, and a friend I gave one to loves hers. Great tracker, get a week+ between charges, waterproof, seems very accurate (compared to my old UP3 and S Health.) Build quality so far looks better than the others I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with band...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase as the first one broke after about one year. One day a side of the band just fell off...the one closest to the the charging thing. I think because the charging cord is so hard to attach to the unit, the band on that side gets stressed, thus weakened. Poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Garmin vívosmart HR Activity Tracker is a one for everything wrist worn device that is an alarm, a pedometer, a calorie counter, as well as heart rate monitor. We have found them to be the very best unit available at any price. The battery last much longer than advertised before needing a recharge. This is our third on of these for the family.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmopolitan Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like all the extra stuff it has, links to my phone, heart rate , weather! I wish I would of gotten a screen protector, I permantly scratched it the first wk. size wise I perfected the first vivos, they had a smaller screen and didn’t feel so bulky on my wrist. I also perfered the band that snapped on the old ones. But for the price it’s great and seems to be far better then other high priced ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and tracker
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for months. I love that it holds a charge for 4-5 days. I like seeing my activity during the day and it helps me want to be more active. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars is because the "stair tracker" is not very accurate. I have gone up and down stairs many times in different locations and am lucky if the watch records one or two flights.
customer_reviews.author: Loves a Mystery

customer_reviews.title: and it has been a good purchase. The price was very reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Garmin Vivosmart HR Activity Tracker for a month or so now, and it has been a good purchase. The price was very reasonable, and it has performed as expected. My cardiologist told me to keep my effort at or below 110 bpm, and this has enable me to check on it. Then I realized that I also appreciated the comfort of the band, the easy to read time function, and I get notifications from my android phone with a slight buzz on my wrist. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice...but staying paired is problematic...and Garmin customer support can't be found
customer_reviews.text: When it's working, I really like it. Heart rate calculation compares closely with my old strap-around-the-chest monitor, the band is comfortable, weather display is a plus, and notifications are good but that's where the problem is. I can't keep the Vivosmart paired with my smart phone (never had this problem with my old Pebble watch). I've reset the Vivosmart but that hasn't helped. Really frustrating...and after searching the Garmin website repeatedly, cannot find a way to contact customer service for help. Looks I'll need to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty B

customer_reviews.title: I like some of the new features that this has to ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Vivofit2 to VivoSmart activity tracker and wanted to keep track of more of my daily exercise. I like some of the new features that this has to offer but question the accuracy in the heart rate and the exercise minutes per week. The exercise minutes seems to add up even when I am not active or at my desk. I do like the feature of the flights of stairs. The band is not as thick and durable as the Vivofit2 and the downfall is that if it breaks you will have to buy a whole new VivoSmart. I purchased the bigger band and wished I got the smaller band since it does seem to stretch overtime.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great device so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this tracker for a short amount of time, but so far it has a lot of things that I really like. My Fitbit Charge HR fell apart, so I decided to try something different, and this seems to be quite comparable. The HR monitor seems pretty accurate (more so than the Fitbit), as well as the step counter. I like the face/monitor and the band is more comfortable than the Fitbit. I also really like that it's waterproof. I was worried that I wouldn't find something as good as the Fitbit, but I'm pretty sure I did.
customer_reviews.author: rockstar

customer_reviews.title: It appears from the response I got that Garmin does not replace bad units with a new one
customer_reviews.text: I picked this unit up to replace a fitbit. From the description it appeared to be an upgrade to the Fitbit. After two months and two weeks the unit will not pair with my phone. Amazons weak return police now requires that I contact Garmin to see what they can do. It appears from the response I got that Garmin does not replace bad units with a new one. If they agree that the failure is due to workmanship they may repair it or replace it with a "RE-MANUFACTURED" unit. It would seem this product is total garbage, i should have gone with $3.99 app for my phone and fanny-pack so I could always have my phone on me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Garmin! I ordered this one based off the recommendation of a friend and it's been great! I've had it since 01/2018. It did have to reset it once or twice due to glitches on connecting to the app but it was an easy fix. I like to be able to track my treadmill workout and see what I need to do to be more active. I have an office job and this keeps me more accountable. Comfortable fit, accurate tracking, and I wear it 24/7!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Felix

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Have used the product everyday for nearly 2 months and love it. I like the ability to sync to my iPhone without a big bulky screen. Tracks my steps, running, stairs, and distance very accurately. My favorite feature is the sleep tracker to see how much deep sleep I’m actually getting so I can adjust my routine if needed. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: It worked but it didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: This product worked fine for 14 months. Having worn out two Fitbits, I thought I'd give this a try. The display screen went blank while on a long trip and I felt like it betrayed me. Maybe my expectations are too high but if you spend $100-125 for a product, I'd like it to last a little longer. No response from Garmin and I don't really expect one since it lasted over one year. I'm not likely to buy Garmin products for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can wear this in the pool without any stress. Does have trouble accurately tracking aqua fitness classes though. It doesn't count the steps you take in the pool if you aqua jog or anything like that, so that's disappointing. I called Garmin and talked to their tech guys and they said that the arm motion doesn't register the same under water. For this reason I'm glad I got the HR because it'll register my water workouts more accurately, even though it might not get the motions I'm making. I also wish Garmin Connect had a way to add group fitness as one of the exercises. A lot of people do that!
customer_reviews.author: jacksonheels

customer_reviews.title: Not very Accurate and Band is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Initially all seemed well, but the device often was not accurate for tracking activity, especially steps. I could climb 20 flights of stairs and it would register one. Steps were sometimes accurate and sometimes not. We have updated firmware and no difference. The biggest disappointment is that the band completely broke just after one year of normal use. Based off where it broke, the plastic is very thin in that spot so it just seems like bad design. Very disappointed for the price we paid. We were hoping for someting better than a f!tbit and were disappointed with our Garmin foray.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Tirrell

customer_reviews.title: I wear it all the time
customer_reviews.text: Got this because I had an old style Garmin that lasted a couple of years and also because it's waterproof. I kayak on weekends and never worry about it, plus the display is easy to read, even in the bright day light. Look forward to getting some different color bands.
customer_reviews.author: Mel D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart device
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch/tracker. Battery seems to last ~5 days. You can setup alerts on pretty much any app you run on your phone (mail, texts/sms, phone calls, google voice alerts, etc.) -- at least on android where I tried. Works well as a tracker. Accuracy of stair climbing is good. I use it for swimming (you need to tell it how many lengths x length of pool). Things that could be better -- would be nice if it figured out you were swimming, and also figured out the distances involved somehow. Unclear to me if the heart rate monitor is actually accurate. I'm assuming it is, but I don't have anything to compare it against...
customer_reviews.author: P. M.

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: it logs steps fairly well. The display is easy to customize and read. I have to charge it weekly but I don't use all the features. The app is nice if you like to fiddle with that kind of stuff. I'd be happier if they still made the old style battery watches though.
customer_reviews.author: lmc919

customer_reviews.title: Garmin produces great products.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Garmin vivosmart Activity Tracker, I loved my first Garmin, but wanted an activity tracker that also tracked my heart rate. I have only had my new Garmin for just a week, but love all the features. We have also purchased two Garmin GPS units, first one had been great for over 10 years. We purchased a second Garmin GPS for a larger screen. I would recommend any Garmin products.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce L. Rife

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: Before this purchase I went through two Fitbits in less than a year due to band issues. My son-in-law and daughter always purchase Garmin and suggested this refurbished option. It is one of the best purchases I have made. The band issues I had with Fitbit do not exist and I am happy with all of its features. I did not think the notifications were necessary but was proven wrong. The Garmin arrived quickly, was a good price and is a addition to my to my fitness journey.
customer_reviews.author: Hardaway48

product_meta.title: Garmin vívosmart HR Activity Tracker Regular Fit - Midnight Blue (Deep Blue)
product_meta.description: Style:Base Model| Size:Regular| Color:Midnight blueWear today's fitness goal on your wrist with Vivo smart HR, activity tracker1 with Garmin Elevate wrist heart rate technology. It's the touchscreen activity tracker with wrist-based heart rate and a full suite of smart notifications2. The sleek band is comfortable to wear all day, and the always-on display shows your stats, even in sunlight. Displays steps, distance, calories, heart rate, floors climbed and activity intensity1. Receive text, call, email, calendar and other alerts on your wrist when paired with your phone. Wirelessly syncs2 to your Garmin Connect account, our free online community where you can join fitness challenges and save, plan and share your progress.
feature_bullets: WRIST-BASED HEART RATE - Tracks heart rate to provide more accurate calories burned information.
SMART NOTIFICATIONS - Displays any notification from your mobile device; calls, texts, social, music, games, etc. with vibration alerts so you don't miss a beat.

INTENSITY MINUTES - Monitor your progress against aerobic activity goals recommended by health organizations such as the American Heart Association, U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the World Health Organization.
ACTIVITY TRACKING - Displays steps, calories, distance, heart rate, floors climbed, intensity minutes and time of day.
NOTE: The image on the packaging shows a brighter blue then the actual unit's color. The actual unit color is a very dark blue. Please refer the User Manual before use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,999 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
